# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) > text_width
            throw(ArgumentError("Word length exceeds specified width: $word"))
        end
        line = "$word "
        while !isempty(line) && (length(line) + text_width < length(text))
            if length(line) > text_width - 1
                push!(lines, line[1:text_width-1])
                line = line[text_width:end]
            else
                break
            end
        end
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer nec odio. Praesent libero. Sed cursus ante dapibus diam. Sed nisi. Nulla quis sem at nibh elementum imperdiet. Duis sagittis ipsum. Praesent mauris. Fusce nec tellus sit amet augue semper porta. Mauris massa. Vestibulum lacinia arcu eget nulla. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. Curabitur sodales ligula in libero."

# Set text width to 10 characters per line
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 10)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function will output the `text` with each line wrapped at a maximum of `text_width` characters. If a word is longer than `text_width`, an `ArgumentError` is thrown.
